dict.string:
#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
tempfile=$(mktemp)
while IFS= read -r line; do if echo "$line" | grep -qE "$KMVAR_local_RegEx"; then : # null statement else echo "$line" >> "$tempfile" ((log_cnt++)) fi done < "$KMVAR_local_LogPath"
mv "$tempfile" "$KMVAR_local_LogPath"
echo $log_cnt

dict.string:
#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
tempfile=$(mktemp)
log_cnt=$(tail -n $KMVAR_local_SpecifiedLogCnt "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" | tee "$tempfile" | wc -l)
mv "$tempfile" "$KMVAR_local_LogPath"
echo $log_cnt

dict.string:
#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
input_string="$KMVAR_local_OldestTimeString"
if [[ ${#input_string} -eq 10 ]]; then # Input string has length 10 (yyyy-MM-dd) formatted_time="${input_string} 00:00:00"
elif [[ ${#input_string} -eq 16 ]]; then # Input string has length 16 (yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm) formatted_time="${input_string}:00"
elif [[ ${#input_string} -eq 19 ]]; then # Input string has length 19 (yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss), no change needed formatted_time="$input_string"
else echo "Invalid input: Unsupported time format" exit 1
fi
time_format="%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" time_seconds=$(date -j -f "$time_format" "$formatted_time" "+%s")
echo $time_seconds

dict.string: Get Engine.log Record Count and Failures and Timeouts

#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts=$(mktemp)
# Extract failure/timeout lines and write to a temporary file and return the failure/timeout count failures_and_timeouts_cnt=$(tail -n $KMVAR_local_LogTailCount "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" | grep -E "Action \d+ failed:|timeout" | tee "$tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts" | wc -l)
echo $failures_and_timeouts_cnt $tempfileFailuresAndTimeouts

dict.string: ### Requires Keyboard Maestro 8.0.3+ ### set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE" tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine" set kmAction to getvariable "local_Action" instance kmInst end tell tell application "Keyboard Maestro" selectAction kmAction activate end tell
For the specifed ErrorIndex extract the Engine Log Failure/Timeout line & update the local_ErrorLines

#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
# Return the log file line with the Failure|Timeout specified (via local_ErrorIndex)
tail_of_errors=$(cat "$KMVAR_local_TempFileFailuresAndTimeouts" | tail -n $KMVAR_local_ErrorIndex)
tail_cnt=$(echo "$tail_of_errors" | wc -l)
if [ $tail_cnt -lt $KMVAR_local_ErrorIndex ]; then echo "" else echo "$tail_of_errors" | head -n 1 fi

dict.string: %Variable%local_InvisibleSeparator% > To backup or advance through the Failures/Timeouts, click Previous or Next. To backup/advance by 5 or 10, hold down Command (⌘) or Option (⌥), respectively. > If the hot key trigger includes Shift (⇧), the Failure/Timeout number will start with the one last viewed when the macro previously ran. > To return to the latest Failure/Timeout, click Latest. To select a Failure/Timeout from a descending list, hold down Command (⌘). To reverse the list order, hold down Option (⌥). > To toggle the display of the Time, Action, and Description variables, hold down Control (⌃) when clicking the Previous, Next, or Latest. > To navigate to the offending action in the Keyboard Maestro editor, click Action. To display the macro name that contains the action, hold down Command (⌘). To toggle the display of the macro name for every Failure/Timeout, hold down Option (⌥). > To open the Keyboard Maestro Engine.log in the Console.app (with this entry selected), click Console. To force a reload of the open Engine.log, hold down Control (⌃). To copy the log entries and open in a text editor, hold down Command (⌘). To reverse the order, hold down Option (⌥). > To delete some (or all) entries in the Keyboard Maestro Engine.log via several reduction methods, click Reduce. To trash the Engine.log, hold down Command (⌘). To retain the latest 100 entries, hold down Option (⌥). > To reveal additional options (e.g., tail -F Engine.log), hold down Command (⌘) when clicking Done. To save the displayed Failure/Timeout to the Clipboard, hold down Option (⌥).

dict.string:
#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
descending=$KMVAR_local_DescendingEntries
truncated_FailuresAndTimeouts_max95=$(echo "$KMVAR_local_FailuresAndTimeouts" | tail -n 95 | cut -c -120)
input=$truncated_FailuresAndTimeouts_max95
IFS=$'\n' read -rd '' -a input_lines <<<"$input"
cnt=${#input_lines[@]}
output=""
for ((i=0; i<cnt; i++)); do line=${input_lines[i]//_/\\_} output+="$((cnt-i))__${line}\n" done
if [ "$descending" = "1" ]; then echo -e "$output" | tac else echo -e "$output" fi
__👉🏿 Select a Failure/Timeout entry to display in the main dialog. __👉🏿 Note: Each entry has been trimmed to 120 characters. %Variable%local_PwlList% cancel__Cancel Macro

__👉🏿 Select a Failure/Timeout entry to display in the main dialog. __👉🏿 Note: Due to a Prompt With List behavior, the list has been limited to the most recent 95 entries, each trimmed to 120 characters. %Variable%local_PwlList% cancel__Cancel Macro

dict.string:
#!/bin/bash PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin
descending=$KMVAR_local_DescendingEntries
root_path="$KMVAR_local_RootPath" time_string=$(date +"%Y-%m-%d_%H%M%S") out_path=${root_path}_${time_string}.txt
if [ "$descending" = "1" ]; then tail -n $KMVAR_local_TextEditorLogEntriesCnt "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" | tac > "$out_path" else tail -n $KMVAR_local_TextEditorLogEntriesCnt "$KMVAR_local_LogPath" > "$out_path" fi
echo "$out_path"

dict.string: delete__delete ⇨ delete Engine.log purge__purge:RegEx ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining all entries except those that match the RegEx keep__keep:RegEx ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining all entries that match the RegEx tail__tail:n ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only the latest n entries today__today ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only entries since midnight days__days:n ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only the latest n days of entries (e.g., days:2 == since midnight yesterday) time__time:YYYY-MM-DD [hh:mm[:ss]] ⇨ modify Engine.log, retaining only records since the specified date/time

__👉🏿 Select a method to delete some (or all) of the entries in the Engine.log __👉🏿 In all cases, a copy of the unmodified Engine.log can be recovered from the Trash __👉🏿 A summary message will appear after the change is made –or– ⌘:𝗕𝘆𝗽𝗮𝘀𝘀 %Variable%local_Methods% cancel__Cancel Macro
